(4) Axway [https://www.axway.com/] Catalysts [https://catalysts.axway.com/]

  • Small team of experts in the digital transformation and API space
    • Help customers to make good decisions on their API journey
    • Move the community of API practitioners and their practices forward
  • Team members are distributed globally

Introduction Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations

(5) Sustainable APIs

  • Every API is a promise
  • Manage the promises that you make responsibly
    • Make promises when they make a difference
    • Be clear about how you are handling your promise
    • Learn from your promises and the mistakes you have made
  • Two simple strategies to become better at making promises
    1. Think about the value you are creating and for whom
    2. Think about becoming a transfer agent for value


Build API Products for API Consumers

Build API Products for API Consumers Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations

(7) API Products

  • API Products are created in the context of (possibly implicit) API landscapes
    • They are influenced by the culture and constraints of the API landscape
  • Product Pillars identify areas of investment during an API's lifetime


Build API Products for API Consumers Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations

(8) API Product Navigator: Pillars



Build API Products for API Consumers Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations

(9) API Design: APIs are Languages [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wDYeU2T4v2o]

  • APIs are part of distributed problem solving
  • Ideal APIs can be used for a range of problems
  • Problem-solving often requires combining APIs
  • Language styles make it easier to learn and use new APIs


Build API Products for API Consumers Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations

(10) API Language Styles [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bWFXGHXo_pY] in the Wild

  • Tunnel Style: XML-RPC, SOAP, gRPC, Avro
  • Resource Style: OpenAPI/Swagger, RAML, API Blueprint
  • Hypermedia Style: HAL, Siren, Atom, HATEOAS
  • Query Style: GraphQL, OData, SPARQL
  • Event-based Style: MQ, WebSub, MQTT, XMPP, AMQP, Kafka, AsyncAPI


Build API Products for API Consumers Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations

(11) API Change Management: Versioning Breaks Things



Build API Products for API Consumers Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations

(12) Plan for Evolution

  • Planning for evolution means to reduce pain in the future
    • No immediate benefits other than doing the right thing
    • Modest effort when part of the API design process and culture
  • Evolution should be part of the API design culture
    • Each API must have a documented plan for API evolution
    • The simplest possible plan may be to never change the API
  • Evolution should be made easy for API consumers

(15) The Platform Business Model



Understanding Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations

(16) But … We're not Google

  • Pure platforms are more the exception than the norm
  • Linear business models can be augmented with platform ideas
  • Creating hybrid models can make a big difference
    • Opportunity to scale because the platform part attracts consumers
    • Ability to differentiate in an increasingly commoditized market
    • Decreasing risk because of more feedback and ability to adapt


Understanding Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations

(19) The API Journey

  • Think about scenarios and consumers
  • Design for change, release early, release often
  • Treat APIs as products with clear ownership and management
  • Consider citizen platforms as a way to improve utility and adoption


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Sustainable API Platforms for Public Administrations
